summary: The Rural Recovery Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Agriculture to establish a technical assistance program for rural communities recovering from disasters. This program will provide assistance with planning, funding applications, and implementation of recovery efforts. Eligible rural communities are defined as census-designated places with populations under 20,000, with the Secretary having modification/waiver options. The bill outlines eligible technical assistance providers, coordination efforts, the duration of assistance, funding allocation, and authorizes $50 million annually for the program.
